File Retrieval

fileretrieval.Rmd
library(glitter)
#> Welcome to Glitter!
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'glitter'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     diff, log
library(tidyverse)
#> ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ──
#> ✓ ggplot2 3.3.2     ✓ purrr   0.3.4
#> ✓ tibble  3.0.4     ✓ dplyr   1.0.2
#> ✓ tidyr   1.1.2     ✓ stringr 1.4.0
#> ✓ readr   1.4.0     ✓ forcats 0.5.0
#> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> x dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
#> x dplyr::pull()   masks glitter::pull()
library(rlang)

HELP!

I find my long lost file on the list as R/logo.R. I then get the commit history of that file using the full path.


fileCommitHistory(filePath = "R/logo.R",
                  repo_path = "~/GitHub/Public-Packages/glitter/")
#> commit 1b9ac7e47fc77f12c21ed2447a71ae8d77a0f37c
#> Author: Meera Patel <patelm9@mskcc.org>
#> Date:   Tue Aug 4 10:37:11 2020 -0400
#> 
#>     move logo.R as GitHub Issue #1 for patelm9/cave package
#> 
#> commit b1541d73a36e20876d83e7430d72e030d64372e9
#> Author: Meera Patel <patelm9@mskcc.org>
#> Date:   Tue Aug 4 10:35:54 2020 -0400
#> 
#>     update logo.R
#> 
#> commit 7c33e4daefbe9ab192ddd62715de7c072bbe2248
#> Author: Meera Patel <patelm9@mskcc.org>
#> Date:   Sat Aug 1 01:15:00 2020 -0400
#> 
#>     add files
#> 
#> commit 6653c8f65d56cc0bc5c486dbe7ee0d5030f7e1d0
#> Author: Meera Patel <patelm9@mskcc.org>
#> Date:   Sat Aug 1 00:49:05 2020 -0400
#> 
#>     update files
#> 
#> commit 864b6437e497755b3de6ec1a219567038c60c75e
#> Author: Meera Patel <patelm9@mskcc.org>
#> Date:   Sat Aug 1 00:25:00 2020 -0400
#> 
#>     add logo

I find the commit SHA where I deleted the file. Using the SHA and path, I am able to retrieve the file.

retrieveLostFile(sha = "1b9ac7e47fc77f12c21ed2447a71ae8d77a0f37c",
                 filePath = "R/logo.R",
                 repo_path = "~/GitHub/Public-Packages/glitter")

Contents

Developed by Meera Patel, MD.

Site built with pkgdown 1.6.1.
